title: Saudi Aramco finally set to launch first stage of its mega-float
text:
Saudi Arabia will float its huge state oil company next month after dramatically scaling back plans for a listing.

The kingdom will list between 1pc and 2pc of Aramco on its domestic Tadawul stock market for an estimated value of over $20bn (£15.6bn).

It represents a major climbdown from an initial bid to list up to 5pc of the company both at home in Saudi and abroad, which sparked a battle between London and New York to win Aramco's business.

The float is expected to happen on November 3, according to a Reuters report.

A spokesman for the oil giant said Aramco does not comment on rumour or speculation.

He added: “The company continues to engage with the shareholders on inital public offering...
description: Saudi Arabia will float its huge state oil company next month after dramatically scaling back plans for a listing.
